Thanks for the detailed explanation of your setup. To enable SSL on your domain `mo0han3d.dev` and its subdomains, you can follow these steps:

1. Copy SSL certificate to Kubernetes Nginx ingress controller:
	* Copy your SSL certificate and private key to your Kubernetes Nginx ingress controller.
	* You can use a Kubernetes secret to store the SSL certificate and private key.
2. Configure Nginx ingress controller to use SSL certificate:
	* Create a Kubernetes secret to store the SSL certificate and private key:
	
	
	```css
kubectl create secret tls tls-secret --key /path/to/your/tls.key --cert /path/to/your/tls.crt -n ingress-nginx
```
	Note: replace `/path/to/your/tls.key` and `/path/to/your/tls.crt` with the actual paths to your SSL certificate and private key.
	* Edit the Nginx ingress controller configuration to use the SSL certificate:
	
	
	```yaml
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
	kind: Ingress
	metadata:
	  name: my-ingress
	  annotations:
	    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-redirect: "true"
	    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-passthrough: "true"
	    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/backend-protocol: "HTTPS"
	    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/secure-backends: "true"
	    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-services: "my-service"
	    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-ciphers: "ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:DHE-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256:kEDH+AESGCM:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA:DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256:DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA:DHE-DSS-AES128-SHA256:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA256:DHE-DSS-AES256-SHA:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:AES128-GCM-SHA256:AES256-GCM-SHA384:AES128-SHA256:AES256-SHA256:AES128-SHA:AES256-SHA:!DSS"
	spec:
	  tls:
	  - hosts:
	    - mo0han3d.dev
	    secretName: tls-secret
	  rules:
	  - host: mo0han3d.dev
	    http:
	      paths:
	      - path: /
	        pathType: Prefix
	        backend:
	          service:
	            name: my-service
	            port:
	              name: http
```
	Note: replace `my-ingress`, `my-service`, and `http` with the actual names of your ingress resource, service resource, and service port name.
3. Configure DNS for your domain and subdomains:
	* Create DNS records for your domain and subdomains to point to the IP address of your Kubernetes Nginx ingress controller.
